paper_title.ja: 老人福祉施設における室内環境の衛生管理に関する研究、第1報一建築物衛生法に基づく実測調査とその結果
paper_title.en: A Study of Method Maintaining a Sanitary Environment at Welfare Facilities for the Aged, Part 1 - Investigation and Result Besed on Legal Measuremnt

description.ja: 本研究は老人福祉施設での室内空気環境の維持管理のあり方について検討することを目的とし､夏季4施設､冬季2施設に対して実測調査を行ったものである｡第1報では調査の概要を述べると共に､デイルーム､事務室および居室に対して建築物衛生法に準じた空気環境測定および浮遊微生物の測定を行い､建築物衛生法の基準値および日本建築学会の浮遊微生物に関する規準値と照合し､検討した結果を示すものである｡建築物衛生法の空気環境基準値を逸脱する室が散見された｡二酸化炭素濃度はレクリエーションなどにより在室者密度が高くなると基準値を超過する傾向が見られ､また浮遊微生物濃度も在室者密度や空調設備のフィルタとの関係が示された｡これらの結果から､施設の運営状態など現状を十分に把握した上で､適切な維持･管理を行うことが有効であるとの見解が得られた｡
description.en: We aimed to examine a method for maintaining a sanitary and healthy air environment at welfare facilities for the aged･ Four we脆re魚cilities were consideredめr summer and two facilities were considered for winter. The seven parameters inHuenclng the indoor air叫ality namely, air temperature, relative humidity air now rate (velocity), and carbon monoxide, C狂bon dioxide､, pa血culate matter, and microbial concentrations, Were measured in accordance with the legal and academic standard method. The results were as follows: (1) It was clear that the temperatures inside the rooms were qulte high in summer and the relative humidity inside the rooms was quite low in winter. (2) The carbon dioxide concentration increased considerably when the population denslty Inside the room became very high. (3) The microbial concentration was quite high in almost all the魚cilities and rooms. It appeared that the創ters installed in me ventilation systems innuenced the microbial concentration. (4) It is impo請ant for the HVAC system designer to grasp the ac血al operatlng COnditions of the welfare Facilities for aged and adopt the most approprlate HVAC system.

publication_name.ja: 空気調和・衛生工学会論文集
publication_name.en: Transactions of the Society of Air-Conditioning and Sanitary Engineers of Japan

paper_title.ja: 建築物における衛生環境とその維持管理の実態に関する調査解析
paper_title.en: Actual Status of Environmental Sanitation and Building Maintenance in Japan

description.ja: 建築物衛生法では,政令で規定される全ての用途の特定建築物に対して同一の建築物環境衛生管理基準が適用される｡しかし,建物の用途によっては,衛生環境の実態や維持管理上の課題が異なると考えられる｡本研究では,厚生労働省が集計している特定建築物立入検査等調査結果をもとに,特定建築物における衛生環境等の実態を把握した｡その結果,二酸化炭素,温度,相対湿度では,ここ10年間で管理基準に対する不適率が上昇しており,特に学校と事務所で不適率が高かった｡これらの原因として, 2002年の建築物衛生法改正で個別空調方式が対象範囲に含まれたこと,省エネルギーに対する意識の高まりや,学校における換気頻度の減少などが推定された｡
description.en: Indoor environments in large-scale comercial buildings are managed under the "Law for Maintenance of sanitation in Buildings" (enacted in 1970) in Japan. The law applies to specific buildings such as offices, stores, entertainment facilities, assembly halls, libraries, museums, and schools, and it establishes environmental standards for carbon dioxide concentration, airborne particulates, carbon monoxide, fomaldehyde, room temperature, relative humidity and air velocity for controlling indoor climate. This study was aimed at examining the actual status of environmemtal smitation and building maintenance by refering to the nationwide on-site building inspection database developed by the Japanese Govement. We analyzed data from 1996 though 2008, The carbon dioxide concentration, room temperatme, and relative humidity were found to increase by a small amount every year, especially in Office and school buildings. The reasons for the tendencies could be me revision of me Law in 2002, which excessively encouraged energy savlng measures in buildings.

publisher.en: The Society of Heating, Air-Conditioning & Sanitary Engineers of Japan

paper_title.en: The possibility of real-time measurement for airborne bacteria concentration in indoor environment
paper_title.ja: 室内環境における浮遊真菌濃度リアルタイム特定の可能性に関する研究

description.en: Traditional method for measuring airborne bacterium is based on two procedures called sampling and incubation. Sampling normally involves drawing a sampler from an air stream or room by means of instruments based on impaction, liquid impingement and filtretion. Incubation of agar plates typically reqires several days. Though the traditional methods can identify the species of microorganisms, they can't obtain any information about suspented viable particles in real time. Te technology for real time detection of the presence of suspended viable particles was developed. In order to verify the performance of a new type measurement IMD (Instantaneous Microbial Detection, Bio Vigilant,Inc), which is used to measure the concentrations of suspended particles with different size distribution based on optical technology and can simultaneously determine whether each particles is inert or biologic in real time. Not only laboratory tests by using latex particles(as a substitute for inert particles) and fluorescence particles (as a substitute for biologic particles) were conducted, but measurements on airborns microbes in six hospital waiting rooms, one office,and one residence were conducted by using an IMD and MG sampler(culture-based, slit type, Mattson-Garvin Inc.)in parallel. Significant correlation between suspended bacterial concentration and biological particle concentration were obtained. The measurement result pointed out that the IMD can measure the fluctuation patterns of suspended bacterial particales in field environments in real time.
description.ja: 浮遊微生物の測定法の培地法では,測定対象となる微生物の種類を同定することが可能になる反面,培養･計数などの一連作業において2日間程度の時間を要する。しかし、IMD技術を応用した方法によれば、空中微生物リアルタイム計測が可能となる。そこでその方法の一般環境への適用について検討を行った。

publication_name.ja: 日本建築学会環境系論文集

paper_title.ja: 台湾における室内空気質と居住者の健康に関する調査研究
paper_title.en: Field Survey on the Relation between IAQ and Occupants' Health in 40 Houses in Southern Taiwan

description.ja: 台湾におけるいわゆる化学物質過敏症（MCS)と呼ばれる患者とそうでない一般居住者の居住環境における差異とMCS症状の強さを表すQEESI指標との関連を現地にて実測調査した。
description.en: Taiwan must face the indoor environmental quality issues, such as SBS, or MCS and other causes, which pollute the IAQ and then make the users appear various mal symptoms persistence. As to clarify the impact connection between indoor air environment and human health, it is necessary to implement of the IAQ testing.

publication_name.en: Journal of Asian Architecture and Building Engineering

paper_title.en: Difference of indoor air quality with various scales of office buildings
paper_title.ja: 事務所建築物の規模による室内空気質の比較検討

description.en: To maintain indoor environments, large-scale buildings have been managed under the "Law for Maintenance of Sanitation in Buildings (established in 1970)" in Japan. Although the large-scale buildings are managed on the indoor environmental standard,the management statuses for small-scale buildings, for example, office buildings smaller than 3000m 2 total floor areas, out of the law are not clear. This study carried out the field measurements of indoor particulate matter, volatile organic compounds (VOC) and airborne microbes both in large-scale office buildings and small-scale ones, and investigated the differences of indoor air quality. As a result, the particle matter concentrations, VOC concentrations and fungi concentrations for the small-scale offices were relatively higher level than the larger-scale ones. It became clear that low air exchange rates and low filtering efficiencies of the air filters in the small-scale buildings could be affect on indoor air quality.
description.ja: 本研究では,事務所として使用されている大規模建築物と小規模建築物の室内空気質の違いについて明らかにすることを目的として,建築物における実測調査の結果について報告する｡これにより,特に小規模建築物における管理手法のあり方についての一助とするものである｡

publication_name.ja: 日本建築学会環境系論文集

paper_title.ja: 病院施設における室内環境の衛生管理に関する研究
paper_title.en: A Study of the Method to Maintain a Sanitary Environment in Medical Facilities, Part 3: Investigation of Air environment by Continuous Measurement of volatile Organic Compounds

description.ja: 本研究は医療施設における室内空気環境の維持管理のあり方について検討することを目的とする｡第1報では調査の詳細および冬期､夏期における計18件の病院の外来待合室､事務室および病室に対する建築物衛生法の測定方法に準じた空気質の実測調査結果を示した｡また第2報では浮遊微生物攫度の実態を明らかにした｡第1､ 2報では建築物衛生法の環境基準値およびHEAS指針値を超過する室が多く見られ､適切に運用するためには､空気環境について定期的に監視することが有効であるという見解が得られた｡本報では､温熱環境､空気質について連続測定や定量分析を行うことによって､より詳細に実態の解析を行った○その結果､室によっては温熱環境の日中変動が大きいこと､室内の浮遊粉じん濃度が外気の濃度に大きく影響を受けていること､ VOC類の濃度は概ね低く抑えられているものの､ DEGEEやカンファーなどが特徴的に検出されることなどを確認した｡
description.en: We aimed to examine the method to for maintain a sanitary air environment in medical Facilities. Nine medical Facilities were induced in this study. The six factorsinfluenclng indoor air quality, namely, air temperature,relative humidity air flow rate (velocity), CO, CO2, andparticle matter, were measured every minute for 6 h at 3 areas inside and outside the medical facilities. The concentrations of volatile organic compounds were also measured. The results were as follows: (1) The concentrations of CO2 often exceeded 1,000 ppm because of insuficient ventilation and its inappropriate operation. (2) The concentration of particle matter outside the facility was clearly influenced by that inside the facility (3) The concentration of p-dichlorobenzene, which is a component of insecticide applied to clothes, was related to the number of the people in the room. (4) Diethylene glycol monoethyl other (DEGEE) and camphor were observed in these medical facilities.

description.en: The Fukushima Prefecture and neighboring areas in northeast Japan were severely polluted by radioactive leakage at the Fukushima nuclear power plant caused by an earth quake. Because we had no experience dealing with such large scale accidents, it became necessary to determine immediately the real extents of the contamination. Air dose and surface contamination density measurements were conducted in a park in Fukushima City to determine the actual levels of radioactive contamination. The results showed that the air dose levels at the park were 0.99 - 3.2μSv/h. In addition, several radioactive hot spots were found, and comparatively larger doses and surface contaminations were found on benches and playground equipment.

description.en: In present research, in order to clarify the actual condition of contamination, the radioactive concentration of the soil and the plant in Koriyama city was measured. It turned out that the radioactive concentration of soil or plants were heavily polluted by caesium-134 and 137, and iodine-131 was already disappeared by its lifetime. Especially, cesium-134＋137 was ranged 3400 Bq/kg at the surface of soil in garden, however, it was remarkably decreased in the deeper point at 10cm and ranged 23 Bq/kg, and we cannot detect the cesium at 15cm. It is necessary for people in Fukushima to decontaminate for reducing radioactivity level. And it turned out that the evergreen plants have been polluted at high radioactive concentration and decontamination by cutting down the plant was decreased by 14% average. Most of radioactive material is removed by removing soils.
